metadata.title: CVE-2019-9936 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In SQLite 3.27.2, running fts5 prefix queries inside a transaction couldtrigger a heap-based buffer over-read in fts5HashEntrySort in sqlite3.c,which may lead to an information leak. This is related toext/fts5/fts5_hash.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9936` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemon - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.2
libsqlite3-0 - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.2
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.2
sqlite3 - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sqlite3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-1ubuntu1.2').
